nodes.bodyText: You may want to checkout com.google.common.collect.Iterables.getFirst(Iterable<? extends T>, T)
Minor: Could you please move this method up to the declarations of _getQualifiedTypeNames?

This local variable is probably not necessary. return (SimpleLookupTable) readField(..) should be fine.
May bad, I misread the diff.
Can you please use a better name for referencesField - it's not a field but a value that was read from the field. maybeLookupTable or readReferences could be better.
Not strictly related, so maybe something for a follow-up PR: This looks like org.eclipse.jdt.internal.compiler.env.ICompilationUnit.getMainTypeName() would be the better candidate to being invoked.

It looks like a better choice, however, I wonder if we can use it here. The public API in this class expects a IJavaElement, whereas, the above is not a Java element.
Please correct me if I am wrong.

True, I ended up in the wrong type when doing the research.
Manipulating strings can be brittle from time to time. Let's keep this as is for now.
We are using the ICompilationUnit from the org.eclipse.jdt.core package. It doesn't provide such a method.
AFAIK capital letters are supposed for long literals. The new Eclipse also has a new warning for this.

You are right. I am leaving a link here for others who might be interested in knowing the reason behind this recommendation (PS Integer Literals section) - https://docs.oracle.com/javase/tutorial/java/nutsandbolts/datatypes.html
Not related to the ticket but is it always /, even on windows?
Hmmm, isn't this just checked in LOG.error itself?
You are right. I'll made the change.
